problem_text: Find the volume of the solid obtained by rotating about the $y$-axis the region bounded by $y=2 x^2-x^3$ and $y=0$.
solution:
From the sketch in Figure 6 we see that a typical shell has radius $x$, circumference $2 \pi x$, and height $f(x)=2 x^2-x^3$. So, by the shell method, the volume is
$$
\begin{aligned}
V & =\int_0^2(2 \pi x)\left(2 x^2-x^3\right) d x=2 \pi \int_0^2\left(2 x^3-x^4\right) d x \\
& =2 \pi\left[\frac{1}{2} x^4-\frac{1}{5} x^5\right]_0^2=2 \pi\left(8-\frac{32}{5}\right)=\frac{16}{5} \pi
\end{aligned}
$$
